Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.2: FLUORESCENCE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique observation number for thefluorescence observed in the analysis.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: COLOR REMARK: A narrative remark about the fluorescence color.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: FLUORESCENCE PERCENT: The percent of fluorescence used in the analysis.
Column Comment.8: FLUORESCENCE REMARK: A narrative remark about the fluorescence.
Column Comment.9: FROM COLOR: The color on the spectrum which outlines the region in which theallowed colors can be used in the fluorescence analysis. The region would bebetween this color and the color stated in the column TO_COLOR.
Column Comment.10: FROM COLOR FREQUENCY: The color frequency on the spectrum which outlinesthe region in which the allowed color frequencies can be used in the fluorescenceanalysis. The region would be between this color frequency and the color frequencystated in the column TO_COLOR_FREQUENCY.
Column Comment.12: FROM COLOR INTENSITY: The color intensity which outlines the value of theallowed color intensities that can be used in the fluorescence analysis. The regionwould be between this color intensity and the color intensity stated in the columnTO_COLOR_INTENSITY.
Column Comment.14: FROM MOBILITY TYPE: The color on the spectrum which outlines the region inwhich allowed colors can be used for dyes in the mobility fluorescence analysis. Theregion would be between this color and the color stated in TO_MOBILITY_TYPE.
Column Comment.15: HYDROCARBON SHOW INDICATOR: A Y/N indicator for the appearance ofhydrocarbon under fluorescent light.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not the fluorescenceanalysis is preferred.
Column Comment.18: PROBLEM INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not there is a problem withthe step. If a yes flag is indicated, additional information regarding the problemshould be noted in the table ANL_PROBLEM.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample.
Column Comment.22: TO COLOR: The color on the spectrum which outlines the region in which theallowed colors can be used in the fluorescence analysis. The region would bebetween this color and the color stated in the column FRIOM_COLOR.
Column Comment.23: TO COLOR FREQUENCY: The color frequency on the spectrum which outlines theregion in which the allowed color frequencies can be used in the fluorescenceanalysis. The region would be between this color frequency and the color frequencystated in the column FROM_COLOR_FREQUENCY.
Column Comment.25: TO COLOR INTENSITY: The color intensity which outlines the value of the allowedcolor intensities that can be used in the fluorescence analysis. The region would bebetween this color intensity and the color intensity stated in the columnFROM_COLOR_INTENSITY.
Column Comment.27: TO MOBILITY TYPE: The color on the spectrum which outlines the region in whichallowed colors can be used for dyes in the mobility fluorescence analysis. The regionwould be between this color and the color stated in FROM_MOBILITY_TYPE.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
